NOTE: THIS OBJECT IS NOT SUPPORTED IN THE CURRENT API VERSION
note: this file is for future reference only!
title: Batch Transfer
name: batch_transfer
description: A transfer batch contains multiple transfers which are processed asynchronously.

sepa_credit_transfer_ids.description: ids of successfully executed SEPA credit transfers

internal_transfer_ids.description: ids of successfully executed internal transfers

sepa_credit_transfer_errors.description: contains a list of errors encountered in nested debits contained in this batch. Transfers are identified by external_uid contained in the original transfer json

internal_transfer_errors.description: contains a list of errors encountered in nested debits contained in this batch. Transfers are identified by external_uid contained in the original transfer json

number_of_transfers.description: count of transfers (internal and sepa) transactions received in this batch

state.description: State of the batch operation. received: We received the batch | processing: Batch is currently being processed | failure: An error occurred during execution of the batch. In this case you should check the transfers. | success: Batch execution has been completed.

success_url.description: Url receiving a POST with the batch object after processing is finished.

filter[account_ids].title: Find transfers belonging to the given account ids. Single id or multiple ids comma-separated.

filter[states].title: Filter by single or multiple csv delimited states

page.title: Page
page.description: In paginated results set the page to look for

per_page.title: Per page
per_page.description: Results per page. Default is 10, max is 100

sort.title: Sort
sort.description: Sort the results in ASC or DESC
